ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would say that it is a very thought-provoking sampling of German intellectual history on the subject of the philosophy of history. I would probably only recommend it to students who have an intense interest in this particular subject and in highly intellectual conversations. Not a general intellectual history course.

If you're willing to put in the work and are interested in German Theory, then absolutely. I could not recommend anything better. It's incredibly focused though, so expect detail over breadth. Would be good to have a strong background in the subject before you focus on a 40 year period.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It made me more attuned to the ideas that animate me, and give me directions to read and think for the future. It also made me appreciate the lineage of ideas.
